result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward J Fitzgerald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater - Domestic Abuse/72 Hours], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward J Fitzgerald

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Edward J Fitzgerald in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee amends to add a Ct. 2, Misd. Battery as a repeater 940.19(1), Class A Misd.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2.  Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1 & the added Ct.  2.

Atty Hendee states that sober link is a part of his 2015 case as well that was held with Judge Slate; the State asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Johnson asks that the jail time be served as his employment allows and approved by the Agent.
Atty Hendee states that it is the parties intent is that the jail sentence would be served at one time.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Serve 90 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on Ct. 2
Report date shall be established anytime during the probationary period that the defendant's employment will allow.  The sentence is to be served all together and not in parts.
Credit = 2 days (if revoked)
Court Costs = $243.00 x 2
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge x 2
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Defendant is to have Sober Link or any other monitoring device at the defendant's expense
bond to be applied; remainder be paid during the period of probation.
Status conference on April 26, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Return date on April 5, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Johnson states that the matter is not resolved and asks for another return.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return
bond continued  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on February 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Johnson asks that the matter be reset to give time to meet with the DA.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.

Atty Hendee states that on 15CF1 a motion will be filed.
Atty Johnson responds.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return; 15CF1 will track  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
for Leave to File Additonal Motions
Return date on January 4, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

with conditions:
*Absolute Sobrity; zero tolerance
*No violent or abusive contact with S.F.

Defendant Edward J Fitzgerald in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Atty Hendee states that the defendant was on a probation hold.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a DPA and will  be filing a motion to terminate that agreement.
  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobrity; zero tolerance
*No violent or abusive contact with S.F.

Court questions the defendant.   Defendant would like to get an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return  Return date scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
